results.title: Atherosclerotic Plaque Fissuration and Clinical Outcomes in Pre-Diabetics vs. Normoglycemics Patients Affected by Asymptomatic Significant Carotid Artery Stenosis at 2 Years of Follow-Up: Role of microRNAs Modulation: The ATIMIR Study
results.text_hl: Moreover, the identification of serum biomarkers could be crucial to predicting @<m>DISEASE_Rupture</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012421 @@@plaque rupture@@@ and MACE in prediabetics versus NG, and specifically in prediabetics under @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy (PDMU) versus pre-@DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetics@@@ without @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ therapy (PDNMU).

citations.NLM: Sardu C, Modugno P, Castellano G, Scisciola L, Barbieri M, Petrella L, Fanelli M, Macchia G, Caradonna E, Massetti M, Paolisso G, Marfella R. Atherosclerotic Plaque Fissuration and Clinical Outcomes in Pre-Diabetics vs. Normoglycemics Patients Affected by Asymptomatic Significant Carotid Artery Stenosis at 2 Years of Follow-Up: Role of microRNAs Modulation: The ATIMIR Study Biomedicines. 2021 Apr 8;9(4):. PMID: 33917851

results.title: Association of Metformin and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair Outcomes.
results.text_hl: Recently it has been suggested that the use of @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ on @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetes mellitus@@@ @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ may lower the prevalence and slow the progression of @DISEASE_Aortic_Aneurysm_Abdominal @DISEASE_MESH:D017544 @@@AAA@@@ (@DISEASE_Aortic_Aneurysm_Abdominal @DISEASE_MESH:D017544 @@@abdominal aortic aneurysm@@@) as well as the risk of @<m>DISEASE_Rupture</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012421 @@@rupture@@@ related mortality.

citations.NLM: Turowicz A, Kobecki J, Laskowska A, Wojciechowski J, Świątkowski F, Chabowski M. Association of Metformin and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair Outcomes. Ann Vasc Surg. 2021 Aug;75():390-396. PMID: 33826959
citations.BibTeX: @article{33826959, title={Association of Metformin and Abdominal Aortic Aneurysm Repair Outcomes.}, author={Turowicz A and Kobecki J and Laskowska A and Wojciechowski J and Świątkowski F and Chabowski M}, journal={Ann Vasc Surg}, volume={75}, pages={390-396}}

results.title: Research advances in drug therapy for abdominal aortic aneurysms over the past five years: An updated narrative review.
results.text_hl: However, the definite therapeutic effects of antihypertensive agents, antibiotics, mast cell inhibitors, antiplatelet agents and corticosteroids on @DISEASE_Aortic_Aneurysm_Abdominal @DISEASE_MESH:D017544 @@@abdominal aortic aneurysms@@@ have not been verified in prospective studies. CONCLUSION: @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@Metformin@@@ provided a positive effect in reducing expansion rate, @<m>DISEASE_Rupture</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012421 @@@rupture@@@ risk, and perioperative mortality.

citations.NLM: Li R, Liu Y, Jiang J. Research advances in drug therapy for abdominal aortic aneurysms over the past five years: An updated narrative review. Int J Cardiol. 2023 Feb 1;372():93-100. PMID: 36462700
citations.BibTeX: @article{36462700, title={Research advances in drug therapy for abdominal aortic aneurysms over the past five years: An updated narrative review.}, author={Li R and Liu Y and Jiang J}, journal={Int J Cardiol}, volume={372}, pages={93-100}}

results.title: Analysis of Antidiabetic Activity of Squalene via In Silico and In Vivo Assay
results.text_hl: The highest @GENE_DPP4 @GENE_25253 @@@DPPIV@@@ level was in @DISEASE_Diabetes_Mellitus @DISEASE_MESH:D003920 @@@diabetic@@@ control- (61.26 +- 15.06 ng/mL), while @CHEMICAL_Squalene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013185 @@@squalene@@@ group showed the lowest level (44.09 +- 5.29 ng/mL). Both @<m>CHEMICAL_Metformin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008687 @@@metformin@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Squalene @CHEMICAL_MESH:D013185 @@@squalene@@@ groups showed minor @<m>DISEASE_Rupture</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D012421 @@@pancreatic rupture@@@ on histopathology.

citations.NLM: Widyawati T, Syahputra RA, Syarifah S, Sumantri IB. Analysis of Antidiabetic Activity of Squalene via In Silico and In Vivo Assay Molecules. 2023 Apr 27;28(9):. PMID: 37175192
